intro: Poa pratensis subsp. sergievskajae, commonly known as the Serгеyevskaya meadow grass, is a subspecies of the common bentgrass. It is native to the European region, particularly found in the western part of Russia. This plant typically grows in moist, temperate grasslands and meadows, preferring well-drained soils. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. The subspecies is noted for its ecological importance in maintaining soil stability and supporting local biodiversity.
